tweets.text: Wettest 24h since 2008 here sweetcorn flooded where @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyNW pumps can‚Äôt keep up for 3 time this year https://t.co/6y4ZX6CItX
@EnvAgency @thameswater not interested! Thoughts? Have sewage out the front of my house. Flowing into rain water gullies https://t.co/BnEvVm15Cr
And the @EnvAgency does what exactly? https://t.co/bNAXQbWW1G

#floodalert #bradfordonavon. Thanks to CEV Su for 17:00hrs report. River level at 27.3m AOD and rising. Pack horse Bridge still clear although getting close to over topping. Barriers all fine @EnvAgencySW @DWFRSBoA @BoATownCouncil @WiltshireRoads @Trow_Fire_Stn @WiltsPrepared https://t.co/bM23RNtrya

Due to increased river levels in York the Foss Barrier has been lowered. It‚Äôs job is to stop the dominant river, the Ouse, backing up the Foss and increasing flood risk. Powerful pumps push the Foss water into a culvert so it can flow into the Ouse. https://t.co/PuVgYqJzH2

tweets.text:
Great progress has been made to dredge the Steeping River and the Wainfleet relief channel.

https://t.co/0xOqxHqZgB

Work only possible thanks to contributions from partners @LincolnshireCC, @eastlindseyDC, @NFUEastMidlands, @W4IDB, @robertcaudwell  @wendybowkett @wmcidb https://t.co/WkH2ii8qrF

Our #Catterick Flood Storage Reservoir is operating. This reservoir #slows the #flow of water in Brough Beck as it flows towards #Catterick and the #A1 in #NorthYorkshire.
#floodriskmanagement #slowtheflow #TeamEA @EnvAgencyYNE @GavinTabinerEA @johncurtinEA @OliverHarmarEA https://t.co/TLjZvZIbj2

Upstream flow gauge back online nowüëçWell done @EnvAgencySE. Currently 220 m3/sec at #teddington weir. River is flowing quickly, fair amount of debris coming downstream too (tree stumps etc, not just bottles), probably washed out of gardens as the level rises. #twickenham

We‚Äôve got teams out monitoring river levels and operating flood risk management assets in the @EnvAgencyYNE region today. Here‚Äôs the current flow rate at our #Ripon Dam asset in #NorthYorkshire. #TeamEA #Incidentresponse #floodriskmanagement #floodaware #plan #prepare #respond https://t.co/EdTePD27ye

Flood alerts have been issued on lower Ure & Ouse. Riverside floodgates in York being closed & Foss barrier expected to come down shortly. Selby lock gates going in for high tides. 
Floodgates in Boroughbridge closed. 
EA officers patrolling Ripon & Catterick flood storage areas. https://t.co/Ta3lQywK5P
Hearing that @EnvAgencyNW #CrostonDam operated which will have probably prevented #flood in #Croston Graphs below at dam; in village & old pic of the dam working (not mine). https://t.co/XsdmFZzPx9

@RichardShead @EnvAgencySE Is this on the shop pontoon ? I saw it earlier. I‚Äôll try and retrieve it tomorrow.
@LastVitesse @scenesfromMK @EnvAgency To be fair, I hadn‚Äôt been able to smell it for a while, and the ducks and moorhens have been back on the pond for a few days so that‚Äôs a good sign üòä

Lunt Meadows NR is closed closed until further notice. River Alt has overtopped at the spillway as per design but has breached at 2 further points undermining the bank. Visitors should not enter from any entrance & especially not walk on the river bank @EnvAgency  @LivEchonews https://t.co/JSybmCojnd

@TW11Harbour @EnvAgencySE I‚Äôm impressed with the large scaffolding plank that‚Äôs resting on the upstream end of the pontoon! Directing water to the left ;) shed load of junk floating down yesterday upriver.

Day 54

The next environmental ticking time bomb will be toxic and dangerous #PFAS and #PFOS chemicals polluting UK waters.

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.
